definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: The atmosphere is indeed getting tensed.
My chest tensed just thinking about it.
You just have to keep him on a tight leash.
sentences.chinese: 你要攏住他只須拉緊一根皮帶。

sentences.english: The columns and tie-bolts are corrected and analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 對立柱墊塊及拉緊螺栓進行了校覈分析。

sentences.english: Then a nut is screwed onto the molded-in stud and tightened with a torque of 6 Nm.
sentences.chinese: 然後堅果被擰緊鑄造在螺柱並且拉緊以扭矩6毫微米。

sentences.english: Bend forward slightly at the hip, keeping your back straight, until you feel a slight stretch in your hamstrings.
sentences.chinese: 保持背部平直慢慢俯身，直到感覺腿筋拉緊。

sentences.english: After the white-gray sails taut to their spars and ropes.
sentences.chinese: 灰繩拉緊白帆袖桅杆向天愁。

sentences.english: He picked up a good-sized piece of gravel and started to wind-up.
sentences.chinese: 他撿起一塊相當大的石子，開始拉緊橡皮帶。

sentences.english: I drew my coat around me and tightened its belt and as I did so I glanced at Parry's shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我拉緊外套，束緊腰帶，這時，我瞥了一眼帕裏的鞋。

sentences.english: She looked back at him, erect, her face like a strained flag.
sentences.chinese: 她回看他一眼，身子挺直，面孔象一面拉緊了的旗子。

sentences.english: she happened to reach the end of the rope there.
sentences.chinese: 她恰巧在最後拉緊了絞索。

sentences.english: In technology of swap, the mechanism of tool holder tension very important.
sentences.chinese: 在換頭技術中，刀柄拉緊機構佔有不可忽視的地位。

sentences.english: The Nite Ize Figure 9 Carabiner tightens, tensions, and secures ropes without knots.
sentences.chinese: 奈愛小號9字鉤可以拉緊任何繩子。

sentences.english: Fold top flap down to the box, pulling tightly, and tape.
sentences.chinese: 把上面的翻蓋朝下折，拉緊，然後用膠帶粘住。

sentences.english: Isometric exercises involve nothing more than tensing a muscle and holding it.
sentences.chinese: 靜力鍛鍊僅僅包括拉緊肌肉並保持。

sentences.english: It was strung at top, center and bottom on 12-gauge spring steel wire.
sentences.chinese: 它在上中下三處以12標號的鋼絲拉緊起來。

definition: to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
